• The contract must be for pecuniary interest, i.e. for money or money's
worth. There must be a financial consideration, no matter how it is paid.
• The contract must be in writing. In the very unlikely event that a contract which
falls within the Directives is not in writing, it will be subject to the general applica-
tion of the rules contained in the Treaty
• The contract must be between two parties: the economic operator and the
contracting authority.
